On 3 Minute Presentations

research  learning-design  presentation  3mp 

3 minute presentations and how I will format them. Instead of giving up when I don't understand something, I want to spend time with the concept and try to really pick it apart until I understand what it means.


Inspired by this tweet, I wanted to challenge myself to learn something new, but to also try and visualize it in a timely manner so others can learn as well. Referencing Blooms Taxonomy, I hope to understand each concept enough to apply it in a written/visual format (level 3 on the taxonomy), and I hope people who view my presentation will at least be able to comprehend the learning (level 2).



WHY WILL I MAKE THESE?

I want to see how easy or hard it will be to distill complex information into something clear, simple, and short to read.

I will spend a maximum of 1 hour making these presentations.



FORMAT

Title:
link to download:
description

something that’s been on my mind that week (which will be next weeks presentation)

Example:

Volts, Watts, Amps, Ohms
What is the difference between each of these and how to they alter how electricity flows through something.

THOUGHT

Everything keyboards, “better” keyboards, history of keyboards?
